org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.session

Class SessionState.LogHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.session.SessionState.LogHelper
  • Enclosing class:
    SessionState

    public static class SessionState.LogHelper
extends Object
    This class provides helper routines to emit informational and error messages to the user and log4j files while obeying the current session's verbosity levels. NEVER write directly to the SessionStates standard output other than to emit result data DO use printInfo and printError provided by LogHelper to emit non result data strings. It is perfectly acceptable to have global static LogHelper objects (for example - once per module) LogHelper always emits info/error to current session as required.

      • logInfo

        public void logInfo(String info)
        Logs into the log file. BeeLine uses the operation log file to show the logs to the user, so depending on the BeeLine settings it could be shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        info - The log message

      • logInfo

        public void logInfo(String info,
                    String detail)
        Logs into the log file. Handles an extra detail which will not be printed if null. BeeLine uses the operation log file to show the logs to the user, so depending on the BeeLine settings it could be shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        info - The log message
        detail - Extra detail to log which will be not printed if null

      • printInfo

        public void printInfo(String info)
        Logs info into the log file, and if the LogHelper is not silent then into the HiveServer2 or HiveCli info stream too. BeeLine uses the operation log file to show the logs to the user, so depending on the BeeLine settings it could be shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        info - The log message

      • printInfo

        public void printInfo(String info,
                      boolean isSilent)
        Logs info into the log file, and if not silent then into the HiveServer2 or HiveCli info stream too. The isSilent parameter is used instead of the LogHelper isSilent attribute. BeeLine uses the operation log file to show the logs to the user, so depending on the BeeLine settings it could be shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        info - The log message
        isSilent - If true then the message will not be printed to the info stream

      • printInfo

        public void printInfo(String info,
                      String detail)
        Logs info into the log file, and if the LogHelper is not silent then into the HiveServer2 or HiveCli info stream too. Handles an extra detail which will not be printed if null. BeeLine uses the operation log file to show the logs to the user, so depending on the BeeLine settings it could be shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        info - The log message
        detail - Extra detail to log which will be not printed if null

      • printInfo

        public void printInfo(String info,
                      String detail,
                      boolean isSilent)
        Logs info into the log file, and if not silent then into the HiveServer2 or HiveCli info stream too. Handles an extra detail which will not be printed if null. BeeLine uses the operation log file to show the logs to the user, so depending on the BeeLine settings it could be shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        info - The log message
        detail - Extra detail to log which will be not printed if null
        isSilent - If true then the message will not be printed to the info stream

      • printError

        public void printError(String error)
        Logs an error into the log file, and into the HiveServer2 or HiveCli error stream too. BeeLine uses the operation log file to show the logs to the user, so depending on the BeeLine settings it could be shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        error - The log message

      • printError

        public void printError(String error,
                       String detail)
        Logs an error into the log file, and into the HiveServer2 or HiveCli error stream too. Handles an extra detail which will not be printed if null. BeeLine uses the operation log file to show the logs to the user, so depending on the BeeLine settings it could be shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        error - The log message
        detail - Extra detail to log which will be not printed if null
